A

App - Class in demolition
 
App() - Constructor for class demolition.App
Loads in the app by creating a new Runner class object, which is the key helper class used to run the program

B

Bomb - Class in demolition
 
Bomb(int, int) - Constructor for class demolition.Bomb
Creates a new bomb object which is instantiated to be in the same position as the bomb guy's coordinates, hence the params will pass in the x and y values from BombGuy's getX() and getY() methods when called by the Runner class
bombDeployed() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Sets the bomb deploy boolean to be false to indicate the bomb has been deployed
bombDeployed() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Sets the bomb to deployed stage by making bombReady false
BombGuy - Class in demolition
 
BombGuy(int, int) - Constructor for class demolition.BombGuy
Creates a new bomb guy object which will be instantiated based on the runner class, where the object's control and methods are run
bombReady() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Returns true if a bomb is ready to be deployed, false otherwise
bombReady() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Returns true if the bomb is ready for deploy, false otherwise
BrokenWall - Class in demolition
 
BrokenWall(int, int) - Constructor for class demolition.BrokenWall
Creates a new broken wall object which extends from all of the attributes and methods from the Icons super class, including setSprite(), draw(), getX() and getY().

draw() - Method in class demolition.App
Runs the program by calling the run() method from the runner class and drawing all of the objects according to the frame updates by the runner class
draw(PApplet) - Method in class demolition.Bomb
Draws the sprite set from the image loaded into the App.java
draw(PApplet, int, int) - Method in class demolition.Explosion
Draw method overrides the existing draw() method defined in the Icons super class, so the explosion can set its display coordinates in the horizontal and vertical directions in adjacent tiles
draw(PApplet) - Method in class demolition.Figure
Draws the sprite set from the image loaded into the App.java
draw(PApplet) - Method in class demolition.Icons
Draws the sprite set from the image loaded into the App.java
draw(PApplet) - Method in interface demolition.IGraphic
Draws the object into the program to be displayed
DynamicMatrix - Class in demolition
 
DynamicMatrix() - Constructor for class demolition.DynamicMatrix
Constructs the two maps which will be drawn onto the screen, with "W" corresponding to solid walls, "B" corresponding to broken walls and " " corresponding to empty tiles

Player - Class in demolition

pressDown() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Moves bomb guy one tile down if there is an empty tile available in the position, otherwise it keeps bomb guy in its current position Also makes changes to the bomb guy's movement direction
pressDown() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Attempts to move the bomb guy figure one tile down
pressLeft() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Moves bomb guy one tile left if there is an empty tile available in the position, otherwise it keeps bomb guy in its current position Also makes changes to the bomb guy's movement direction
pressLeft() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Attempts to move the bomb guy figure one tile left
pressRight() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Moves bomb guy one tile right if there is an empty tile available in the position, otherwise it keeps bomb guy in its current position Also makes changes to the bomb guy's movement direction
pressRight() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Attempts to move the bomb guy figure one tile right
pressSpace() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Deploys a bomb at the position of bomb guy's current coordinates
pressSpace() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Deploys a bomb
pressUp() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Moves bomb guy one tile up if there is an empty tile available in the position, otherwise it keeps bomb guy in its current position Also makes changes to the bomb guy's movement direction
pressUp() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Attempts to move the bomb guy figure one tile up

run() - Method in class demolition.Runner
Called to update the frames each second by calling the tick() methods of many of the classes Every time the draw() method is called, the run() method automatically is run and governs the behaviour of all objects shown on the screen
Runner - Class in demolition
 
Runner() - Constructor for class demolition.Runner
Creates a new runner object which is instantiated every time the program is run It also serves to create instance objects of all of the other classes which will be updated each frame

TextDisplay - Class in demolition
 
TextDisplay(int, int) - Constructor for class demolition.TextDisplay
Displays all of the differen texts all according to their position.
textFont(PFont, float) - Method in class demolition.TextDisplay
Displays text with the font and size inputted
textSize(PApplet) - Method in class demolition.TextDisplay
Sets the text size to be used to display the text
tick() - Method in class demolition.Bomb
Main method used to update the frame of the bomb Every time this method is called, the timer is incremented by 1 until the bomb detonates, at which point the bomb will check its surroundings for solid and broken walls
tick() - Method in class demolition.BombGuy
Updates the map according to any changes made by the player's actions, including loading level 2, reset of level 1 and level 2 and replacing broken walls
tick() - Method in class demolition.Figure
Abstract method tick used by the subclasses to update their position, movement and direction each frame
tick() - Method in interface demolition.IUserControllable
Updates the position and status of the game
tick() - Method in class demolition.RedEnemy
Updates the map by incrementing a timer for the red enemy's movement and interacting with the map environment Based on the AI, the red enemy will make a movement every second, which will update its position and direction
tick() - Method in class demolition.Time
The method used to update the frame each tick and increment the timer If the tick is called 60 times (one second), the timeCount will be updated by decreasing the value of the time remaining by 1
tick() - Method in class demolition.YellowEnemy
Updates the map by incrementing a timer for the yellow enemy's movement and interacting with the map environment Based on the AI, the yellow enemy will make a movement every second, which will update its position and direction
Time - Class in demolition
 
Time(int, int) - Constructor for class demolition.Time
Creates a new time object at the start of the game which extends from all of the attributes and methods from the TextDisplay super class, including text(), createFont(), textFont(), textSize(), getX() and getY().
timerReset() - Method in class demolition.Time
Resets the timer by setting timeCount back to 180 seconds and the incrementing time back to the default of 0
timerUndo() - Method in class demolition.RedEnemy
Reverts an incrementing of the timer by decreasing the count by 1
timerUndo() - Method in class demolition.YellowEnemy
Reverts an incrementing of the timer by decreasing the count by 1
